ai.summary: Lurgies Walk is a short, easy 2.7 km route in the UK suitable for beginners and families. The walk offers a relaxed stroll along well-maintained paths, with gentle terrain and the chance to enjoy nearby scenery in around 45–60 minutes at a comfortable pace.
ai.terrain_summary: Predominantly flat or gently undulating terrain with defined tracks, grassy paths, and some compact earth sections. Surfaces can be muddy after rain and may include minor steps or boardwalks in damp areas. Good footwear is recommended.
ai.safety_notes: - Check weather and daylight conditions before you go. - Wear sturdy shoes and dress for the conditions; bring a waterproof layer. - Stay on marked paths and respect any local access rules. - Carry water, a small snack, and a simple map or offline navigation. - Keep dogs under control and be mindful of others on shared paths. - Be cautious of slippery surfaces when wet and step carefully on uneven ground.
recommended_gear: Sturdy walking shoes or light hiking boots
Weather-appropriate clothing and a compact waterproof layer
Small daypack with water and a light snack
Map, compass or offline GPS (or a charged phone with offline access)
Sunscreen, sunglasses and a hat for sunny days
ai.best_seasons: All year, with best conditions in spring to autumn; summers are popular, winters may be muddier.
